page.title: 01General Summary.
page.content: This part of St. Mary's is quiet and peaceful with no industrial development. It is renown for its' natural beauty and temperate climate. It is ideal for the tourist who seeks relaxation and is often referred to as the Fortunate or Friendly Isles. There are superb coastal footpaths leading torocky headlands and small coves pllus anature trail which folllows a stream to Porth Hellick Pool. The island is a favourite with birdwatchers who come to see the seabirds and rare migrants whidh pass through here in spring and autumn. The mild climate enables the farmers to produce early flowers of the daffodil variety in small fields with high hedges of pittisporam for protection. Fishing is also an important part of the economy,particularly for shellfish although there are a few trawlers.
